main event: Observation of 3 unusual aerial objects near Tooma, N.S.W., Australia on 5th January 1954.
interesting points: The objects were observed for 10-15 minutes while weaving in flight towards the West., The reported sightings were made by two witnesses on a fishing holiday with a third person alleged to have seen the objects., The objects were described as having high intensity lights and were oval or circular in shape., Witnesses reported a smooth flight path with objects continually maneuvering., There was no physical evidence of the objects, and no other similar aircraft were reported in the area at the time.
witness description: Two witnesses were fishing and claimed to have extensive experience in aircraft spotting.
